name: Joy Division Original Version
description: The idea behind this experiment is to recreate the album cover of Unknown Pleasures by Joy Division. This design represents the wavelengths emitted by the first discovered pulsar CP 1919, which was later transformed into an album cover by Peter Saville. This aims to explore how scientific data can be transformed into digital art by uing perlin noise.

name: Line movement
description: For this version of Unknown pleasures album cover I wanted to create some movement of the lines that reflect the movement of the radio wavelengths from CP 1919.

name: Text Distortion
description: For this experiment I wanted to play with movement and distorted text. The main idea is to create a more colourful piece when compared to the previous ones, and for the text to be legible.

name: Cube arrangement
description: This experiment uses Georg Nees'Schotter (1968-1970) as an inspiration. In this assignment I aim to use simple a simple shape, the cube, in order to recreate his work.
